My note 9 broke so I looked online for a replacement. Despite those around me saying not to I decided to try a renewed phone. Now I'm not sure how I feel about it after a week of use.Here are the defects I found after a week of use:~The pen doesn't work. As you can see in the photos, the pen doesn't click in all the way and hangs out slightly. This results in the pen not charging and being unusable.~In the description, they say there are no noticeable blemishes from 12 inches, but I can definitely see them from 12 inches. You can see the major blemishes in the photos.~Every now and then maybe 30% of the time the speaker seems to die off. It sounds like the speaker is being covered up and it is hard to hear the person on the other end of the call.~Battery life seems weaker than my previous note 9 which I had for about a year. So, either my previous note 9 retained more than 80% capacity or these ones currently don't have at least 80% capacity as promised.~Data is a bit spotty from time to time. I didn't have these problems with my previous note 9.I'm still debating if I should return it. Just don't expect the "Product works and looks like new" promise they have in the description.**EditDecided to return.

column1: Do not buy phones from Amazon.
column2: I would not recommend buying a phone from Amazon. The phone I ordered was supposed to be unlocked and not tethered to any network. It specifically says in the description that it's not.But yet I get the phone and first thing I see is all the verizon logo stuff pop up. It's a Verizon phone. I can text and call but it will not allow me access to my data plan. Will not allow me to update APN setting to fix this either. The seller game me some b.s. excuse saying that the phone is unlocked from any carrier, that the reason it's showing verizon is because of the SIM they put in it to test it put all the Verizon stuff on there automatically. And that all I need to do is pop in my carrier SIM and it will remove the Verizon stuff and replace it with my carrier stuff. That is not how it works.

column1: Not US firmware, was not Verizon compatable.
column2: I asked the seller before I purchased if the model number was SM-N960U where U is US, was told yes and it was VZ compatible.When received, the phone was in very nice condition.However, noticed that it was the "N" version and was would not register on Verizon's network.Return request took forever from seller, refund was not issued until seller received and not like I normally see when UPS scans code. Once refund was issued, it was in Amazon gift card rather than a credit back to account.Never again will I chance a phone purchase from Amazon.I tried two sellers, and this was the second that is false advertising.
Samsung is always a reliable product.Even the refurbished is satisfactory.

Which I needed for Sunday. Well it came about Wednesday so it was perfect. I thought. Went to a shop to have the screen protector installed. You can’t use t-mobile phones on Verizon and even if it were an option I purchased a Verizon phone. I paid for what I wanted not for what the feel I wanted. Contacted them they pretty much told me oh well. That I could use it. No I can’t. Not even an offer to make it right. Just told oh we’ll send it back. Amazon stated they would overnight the correct one. The company didn’t even bother to make their mistake right! Seriously save your time, money, and stress. Buy elsewhere.

When you order a full "unlocked" phone from samsung direct, it does not have a carrier rom flashed to it, its stock samsung android. column1: Phone is great, but here's the catch.....
column2: Note 9 is operational, in good condition, works as it should. But, here is the catch. They sent me a GSM ATT note 9, instead of the advertised Verizon CDMA note 9. In my situation, it wasn't the BIGGEST deal because I already used a GSM carrier, but was going to go to Verizon. So, the phone still works for me, but, if this were to happen to someone else that had say Verizon and did not want any notion of swapping carrier, this would be problematic for them and they would have to take the time to send it back, get a refund, or send it back to have another sent which raises the risk of it happening again. Best part is when you opened the sim tray, they left in a very beaten old Verizon sim in there like they were trying to insinuate that it was Verizon restored when it was in fact not. Long story short, be careful where you order from.

column1: Renewed Samsung cell delivered with a jammed sim chip drawer. Phone totally useless.
column2: Phone delivered with jammed sim drawer--could not be opened. Careless technical work and incompetent quality control.Re-Cell in Thornton Colorado is responsible for renewal and sale. I hope Amazon takes this info under advisement and rethinks its relationship with this company. I spent an hour chatting online with the manufacturer who could NOT come up with a solution other than my finding a service outlet that MIGHT be able to correct problem and of course, I PAY FOR THEIR SERVICES. I would have to call for an appointment, however I don't have a functioning phone.

Updating this review. Buyer beware: if you purchase this phone, there is a chance (probably high) that it is not renewed with authentic parts. Mine started to fail after 6 months. I had to pay almost $300 to fix the phone because of this. I contacted the seller. Their only response was, "the warranty is 90 days." So just be warned, this phone is unlikely to last unless you have Samsung themselves repair it, and the seller gets away with that, as long as it lasts 90 days. For me, it was the screen that was failing. So be warned.

I love this phone. Don't get me wrong. But the screen is so fragile, and easily scratched, and the phone is not balanced right. Regardless of where I put this phone it always falls. And when it falls it hits the screen. My note8 lasted me well over a year and never had this problem. The first week I had this phone the screen just cracked for no reason. Now I dropped it with a case and the corner of the screen shattered. We're talking a four foot drop with a case broke this screen. That's two screens damaged with this phone. My note8 regularly traveled with cheap cases or no case and it had literally no scratches and I NEVER had to replace the screen. I could put my 8 anywhere and it never fell, and if it did, the screen was FINE.My aunt has the same phone. She regularly has no notification sounds or the screen won't light up so she can answer the phone.Between the fragility of the screen, the balance, and the notification issues I'm not impressed with how much it's worth.
Came with scratches on the screen, and it had At&t boot apps

So I go through straight talk and I was looking for a better phone without having to pay an outrageous amount. Last year I ordered this phone "UNLOCKED" only to find out that it was still locked to only Sprint and AT&T. Normally probably wouldn't have been a problem but I live in an area where both of those have no service here. Disappointed, however it was my own fault and should have thought about it before hand. Verizon is the only service here that works amazing in my area so I just ordered the VERIZON edition and can't wait for it to show up around the 9th. That being said. The phone I ordered last year was AMAZING. No dents, scratches. Everything worked better than expected. Phone was in absolute perfect condition and packed very well. I think it even arrived sooner than expected! Even though I made the mistake of ordering the wrong one, I still quite enjoyed using it as a back up for pictures and games that I can't normally download on my measly J7. If you have read into this comment so far, Just be smart about it. Just because a phone says it is unlocked, doesn't necessarily mean it is unlocked to your specific carrier.Pick the service you actually want. If your provider isn't listed then contact the carrier you go through and ask them what works best with their service. That simple. If I would have taken the time to actually ask what would be best and compatible with Straight Talk I wouldn't have made that mistake in the beginning. Anyway, Excited for the new one to get here soon! Can't wait to get rid of my J7! :)

I just received this today & was super happy to find out my Verizon sim worked perfectly with this one. In the description it said it was not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, etc. but upon reading some of the reviews that it did work, I took a chance. So YAY. Not a single scratch and I love the lavendar/pink color.I would def recommend.I got mine from seller Edge Cellular - not sure if that helps.

Never buy a refurbished or used phone, although all companies state that the phone was inspected and runs excellent expect glitching, slow load times, over heating, bad batteries.This is coming from someone who worked in the phome industry for years. Rarely have I seen a refurbished phone that didnt have functional issues.

Unit came with little to no charge, could not finish setting up before battery died. I had it plugged into USB 3 cable, only after I realized that it would not charge using cable (did try other known good USB 3.0 cables). In the end I found I could charge it wirelessly in my car, and will have no choice but to purchase wireless charger. My main issue is I need to take this with me when traveling, and I do not have the available time to return & replace now, so I am stuck with the phone. By time I get back the return period will have ended. Still no idea if phone works well or not, very frustrated this had to happen and certainly a lot of bad timing. However phone was obviously never tested or checked, so I assume I will have to buy a new one soon.
3rd Amazon phone purchase over the years. This is my 2nd Note, I jumped from the 3 to the 9 & am highly impressed! Definitely recommend. Similar to the 3rd. But with loads of cool new features!!!

After a few day's use, I noticed that some icons and status bar (from an older version of the OS lock screen) were burned into the screen. Noticeable on a white background (like when drawing, which is where I first saw it), very noticeable against grey or blue. Color-cycling app didn't "fix" it completely. Definitely does not meet the standard of "unnoticeable at arms length".I had to pay hundreds of dollars to have a new screen put in. And then even more to have the battery replaced and a new back installed when they discovered the old one had blown out some.The included charger (or the phone itself) doesn't fast charge.The camera (still) has a bad internal glare at night with flash activated (when exposure is high) that I never saw with my S8.It's a Note 9, so it's a good phone, but overall this particular one was pretty messed up, and even after spending a bunch more money on it, it's still not in perfect shape.It was a gift, so I don't know who specifically fulfilled my order, but they should be fired until they improve their QA process.

column1: Im not a verified customer, However Im a real homie.
column2: Heres the facts. The hard facts.I got my Note 9 from Sprint, in a nutshell Sprint is a 2.5 Star of 5. But this aint that.The Note 9 is a beast of a product. Fragile sure but its a power house. I upgraded to this phone from the S7 so maybe I just think its so awesome coming from a 2 yr gap, but Im sure I know my tech and I know what impresses me.Believe me if you want, this aint even my account my grandma has unlimited prime so I just be using this lol. THE NOTE 9 IS A BEAST! Anything you could want in a phone. However I will leave my Pros, and Cons.Pros:- Im going to make this short...... You couldnt be unhappy with this phone. No compromises.- The facial and eye reading stuff makes unlocking a breeze in tight situations where you can particularly touch your finger sensor or draw in your code. Just facial is faster but face and eyes are best security.Cons:- I feel the curved edges make screen protection difficult. Ive went though 3 tempered glass protectors, all cheaper ones. Havent tried whitestone yet because of price, however I have tried Ni-Shen liquid adhesion, Wehasi 2 pack, and also WTOSE's protectors, none of which worked well sent all of them back.- Cases made for this phone, because of the curved edges, make it difficult to find the right case, I sent 1 back and got an otterbox symmetry series case, which also does not fully protect the screen in a drop because the lifted beveled edges do not protect the screen when dropped on a jagged edge.Overview:Its the best phone Ive had. Im not really rough on my phones so I dont mind the edges and I pay insurance through a carrier, so its not a major deal to me.Buying this unlocked you take on the full responsibility of repairs so I cannot speak on the seller, nor their product. This is simply a review on the phone itself.

Bought this as a replacement for my Note 5 which I enjoyed until it abruptly failed to turn on one day. Tried replacing the battery to no avail so I replaced it with the Note 9. I loved this phone until after owning it for 1 year and 2 weeks. While using my phone today the screen abruptly dimmed/faded and took on a green hue. It is functional but it’s terribly ugly and puts a strain on the eyes. I will NEVER buy another Samsung phone again

So far so good!I received the phone in timely fashion and it came in good packaging. I took the phone to my current carrier, T-mobile and had them verify that the litmus water paper showed it was in good condition because I felt that would let me know how throughly it was refurbished.IT WAS Perfect so I transferred my info and am now using the phone. I'm very happy with it.Works perfectly.However, I know that occasionally refurbished phones work great until they don't.Sometimes they start out fine and after a few months, you run into an unknown or unforseen glitch. So I can't speak to that yet.Send my another opportunity to review in 6 months and I'll tell you if it all works out as good as I hoped.

I have 3 refurbished note 9 phones all bought from this seller.This is two of the 3 I'm sending back. One was fine,one would not hold a phone charger cord it would just fall out or any movement and it was not charging. The replacement they sent was fine. Now on number 3, the back is falling off.It came this way.It's a gift for my kid.Birthday is in a few months but shop early in case you have to work out defective devices.Hopefully the replacement will be fine.Over all I've have good experiences with these but you are buying refurbished so inspect it very well.I had a few scratches not very noticeable.I'm happy with the price and quality.I would buy again. Don't like sending things back fingers crossed the next one will be ok.... nope! Opened the box and the screenis cracked,this seller says they don't take back broken phones like cracked screens,they better have my money.I'm going to be giving that money to a different seller. I bought 3 of these phones but the other two might not have came from this seller.Two in a row are no good.This seller has no quality control.

This note 9 is a great phone but for some reason the Group texting is capped at 10 contacts. If you have a group that has over 10 members that you need to send a text to as a group message, this phone cannot do it! I have reached out to Samsung about this issue several times over the past year to see if they can fix it with an update but they couldn't help me. Now I have to buy a new phone just to be able to communicate with my team at work.

I got this product for my fiancee, since he needed an upgrade from his Note 4.He was going to a get refurbished one from ebay, but when I read the reviews for the refurbished phones here, I figured if it is almost as good as new, then why not? It has been under 2 weeks since he had it and he just activated it last weekend, but he likes it so far.Longer battery life, the GPS tracker is not as slow, and he has more camera features.He did mention about the phone using more energy when he is using it to take pictures and video (the phone gets warm to hot), since the processing of pictures uses more energy (?) Is this common for Note phones (or the Note 9)?I would not know since I am an iphone user.The Note 9 also uses a different charger from his Note 4, so he had to buy the additional accessories.But so far, so good.

There were some miniscule scratches along the bottom side of the phone that are virtually undetectable after putting a tempered glass screen protector on.
Considering the Note 9 is upwards of $1,000 I am very thankful to have received such a high quality phone for $600.

This phone retails for $1000.00 at a Verizon store. You expect me to believe that these are not stolen? Maybe if they were $850 or higher, that would be more believable. If they aren't stolen, then they will not be unlocked properly. And if they are locked to Sprint, then it's more than likely a Sprint employee taking them.

column1: Samsung Certified Renewed Does Not Equal Good Quality Control
column2: I was gifted a renewed Note 9 to replace my current Note 9, because AT&T's 3G sunsetting arbitrarily means they cannot support any phones that aren't specifically US versions. Unfortunately, they paid the extra $100+ for the Samsung Renewed in hopes that I would get the correct version, as 3rd party sellers are spotty on sending the right specifications.I got the correct version, at a price. Samsung is charging extra to do a lousy QC job. One side of the screen has a slight purple tint, and it is noticeably dimmer than the other side in dark mode. Having to replace a perfectly good phone is frustrating, paying extra for a flawed replacement is even more so.
Great condition, so scratches or issues. Fully functional.
Camera is junk wont focus on anything more then 6 inches away makes the phone worthless for photos.
After 20 daysappear a very annoying message when I try to charge the phone, and it's never be exposed to the water.I don't recommend this phone.

You are getting the luck of the draw when you buy one of these refurbed phones. There might be scrathes and minor cracks in the screen. Also these phones are cheap because they dont have (4g LTE) they have the slower 3g Lte. This company doesnt list that info in the product description cause they know you wont buy it if they did. If you dont mind slower internet speeds and minor defects then you should buy this phone. My phone is in decent shape but doesnt support the faster 4g lte data speeds. That's the catch with this phone

column1: Samsung renewed is the way to go!
column2: I have a Note10+ that I bought new almost two years ago and I love. I mean my phone has it all. My husband's old dumb phone is now obsolete so I wanted to get him something as awesome as my Note10+, but money is tighter now than it was two years ago. The Samsung renewed Note9 looks brand spanking new! It came in a new sexy Samsung box with all new doodads. It has the same warranty as new. This phone sells for double the price as new on Samsung. So half price for a phone you can't tell is renewed is a no brainer. From now on if I ever need to upgrade, I will do Samsung renewed. But I sure hope that doesn't happen for many many years.The phone itself is pretty darn close to as wonderful as my Note10+. I can tell the difference in the camera, but I'm a photographer.It works the same and has an artillery of functions built in. It's fine for my husband. The phone is slightly smaller than the Note10+, but barely a difference. I think this screen is possibly safer from breaking than the Note10+, as it doesn't go all the way to the edge.I don't like the Bixby button on the left side, as I have a power button there on my phone, so as I was setting up the Note9 for my husband, I've repeatedly pressed it, bringing up Bixby. But I imagine it will be no problem for my husband as he does not have that habit.The finger print scanner being next to the camera seems like a bad idea. My husband keeps touching the camera to use it, but hopefully he'll get better at it. On a Note10+ the finger print scanner just shows up on the screen when you need it and then disappears. Much better.The pen is great! You will love using it. It is not a dumb pen like in other types of phones, but a bluetooth that can do stuff to blow your mind. There's this dude I will mention further in this review, he can help you learn all about that. I recommend an app called Sketchbook for drawing and art stuff. While the Notes app is good, this one has a ton more features and art supplies. I just discovered it today, thanks to my daughter's recommendation and it's a pretty big difference. It's free and apparently beloved by many artists.The phone updated to Android 10 and One UI 2.5, in case anyone wants to know. I think that may be as high as they go.Pretty much everything else works the same as the Note10+.I think we got a great deal and I'm happy my poor husband finally has a smart phone.Something I recommend to everyone I know: We do BYOP on Tracfone. We do not select their low monthly payments, just the occasional adding on of data and minutes. It's so cheap there and they use AT&T towers. Same great coverage and we don't have ridiculous monthly payments. Since this is his first smart phone I had to buy a year card with them (normally $120) and I found a $50 off coupon for that at TracfoneReviewer online. There's always coupon codes for tracfone there. With my Note10+ I spend no more than $160 a year for minutes, data, text, and time. That's it. It's always been enough. I highly recommend Tracfone. Don't sign up for a monthly plan with them. It's not necessary. And you can always do that if you find you need it. Also their prices are upfront. No added fees. Ever. Just saying. You're already thrifty looking at a renewed phone, go all the way! Save money. We've been using Tracfone for 17 years at least. If you think you are interested in doing that, make sure to order the Tracfone Sim Card kit with this phone. It is usually anywhere from $1 if it's sold by Amazon, or $5 from a private seller. Free if you ask Tracfone, but be prepared to wait forever for it to arrive. Depending on where you live you could end up using Verizon, AT&T, or TMobile towers. The Tracfone website let's you know which SIM card you will need.Now, this next piece of advice is gold. There's this awesome tech guru on youtube called sakitech. He has 1.5 million subscribers for a reason. Look for "250+ Samsung Galaxy Note 9 Tips, Tricks and Hidden Features" by Sakitech and set some times aside. Go at your own pace. You too will be a Sammy guru when you're done. You will know how to do all kinds of stuff on your Samsung Note9 (or 10+ if you go that route, he has a video for that too). I'm so glad I saw his Note10+ video. It helped me to get more out of my phone from day one. And he is easy to understand.Oh yeah I noticed the bad reviews in this listing. That was for other sellers. As long as it says SHIPS AND SOLD BY AMAZON, and it is SAMSUNG CERTIFIED RENEWED, you are golden. If not, as you can see from the bad reviews, well you're playing the Amazon seller lottery.Okay, I've done what I can here. I like helping people and I hope my tidbits have helped you. Enjoy this phone!

column1: I got what I ordered (an unlocked used note 9)
column2: Ok I get it. Some people say they didn't get what they ordered. I did. I got a note 9 in excellent condition and unlocked. It works with metro PCS (T-Mobile towers) and had no issues getting put on my plan. I'm not saying other people didn't have issues but I will be ordering a second one for someone else on my plan. I don't know why some orders are better than others and if I get a bad phone on my second order I will update this one as well as saying so on the review for that one, but as for now I got what I wanted and I'm not sure the "scam" is on the sellers side. Just remember people want stuff for free; so if they think a bad review will get them something for nothing they will put heart and soul into it. Our society is sad and there's definitely alot of "I deserve". Just tell people you got what you got. Don't talk crap about something if it's not true. If you wrote a bad review for something and it didn't deserve it then you should be ashamed; then again if you were able to then of course you won't feel bad about doing so. You think every company can afford every sing person getting free stuff. It's sad... Just so sad. People like that don't understand saying "they can afford it" means bankruptcy. Imagine how many people say it every day. You think you are the only one trying to scam a company? You are not even close to the first person to think of that "scam". You are just another freeloader trying to get something you don't deserve. Stop ruining small business trying to make your life better. You will still be bitter and angry that no one likes you. Just because you have a new phone doesn't make you cooler or more important and telling people you got it for free because you cried about something makes people like you less. Pay for what you get and get what you pay for. If you don't like it then send it back. Stop expecting to get an amazing deal because everyone is thinking just like you; make money and don't get taken advantage of.

UPDATE- Returned phone because it is really hard to see the screen in the daylight and the sound was really bad. I listen to podcasts a lot and if I didn't have my ear buds and had to use the speaker on the phone I could hardly hear it. Its a nice phone but not worth $300 to me.I looked around for a week or two before I made this purchase because I was nervous to spend so much money on a phone and the negative reviews didn't help. I went through the list of sellers and found Toronto cellular, they had 100% positive feedback and I can see why. I placed my order for a fully unlocked note 9 on 7/2 and received it on 7/3. It came in great condition with a Samsung fast charging cable and box and the sim card removing tool. I put my cricket wireless sim card in and it was good to go. I'm very happy with my purchase so far and its pretty awesome they give you 90 days to return it if need be. If you're on the fence about buying this phone,or any on here, as long as you chose a good seller with high positive feedback it should be fine and you have the 90 day warranty either way.

I am loving my Samsung Galaxy Note9! Definitely unlocked, the price was right, and the device is nearly perfect! There are 2 hardly noticeable, slight, tiny scuff/scratch marks, that you wouldn'teven notice unless I pointed them out. Looks fabulous, nice and shiny, functions perfectly.I chose the phone I really wanted, and my service provider, Boost's customer service department helped me get it activated. If you are hesitating, keep in mind that most providers have a "Bring Your Own Device" option, so check with your provider.The seller was very helpful, and offered support for any problem that may arise. Having an unlockeddevice is essential, but sometimes the model number could be an issue with your phone service provider. No worries though, because that can be resolved by "flashing" the device. I had never heard that term before, but there you have it! Get the unlocked phone you want, and your provider should be able to set you up.

My principal use for a phone is communication, my old Casio had reached the end of it's service life [it was 3G and Verizon doesn't offer 3G any longer]. I have large hands and fingers and find a typical smart phone difficult to operate, shopping Amazon Renewed, I found the Samsung Note 9S fit my needs and wants at a favorable price point and ordered one. Worked as described, the stylus allows me to enter numbers and data quickly and precisely, and I am satisfied.1 caveat, the first phone delivered had a display problem and was replaced by Amazon. The replacement is running good.

Phone arrived looking like new, then I noticed it was 128gb and not the 512 I ordered. When I contacted seller they responded quickly, we agreed on a solution and Im happy. All these phones are unlocked regardless of what is shown on boots screen. After awhile of owning phone most get service provider updates and they will just show Samsung on bootie. If your service provider uses sims card. If not I dont think this phone will work for you. Ive had a Tmobile,AT&T and now they all boot up with Samsung logo on puretalkusa. So don't get confused on startup. Wherever the phone was originally purchased will go away after activated and used for awhile.

I bought this to replace a Pixel 3a XL. So far it has been a great replacement, with comparable battery life and several great features (although it can feel a bit bloated at times). The best part is I was able to use the same third party launcher (Nova) rather than the default to keep my home screen clean and apps well organized. The pen is fun to use although it takes some getting used to, especially for drawing. One thing I can do without is the Bixby button, but you can change it so that the button can open apps or functions so that's neat. Overall this is a great phone that I'll hopefully be using for a long time.

I received the phone and it looked decent for a used phone. The "sim removal tool" was a paperclip. It worked but they should just say a paperclip because I almost threw it away because it's not what the description said. The phone worked great for about a week then it started resetting and powering down on it's own at random times then almost constantly. Also the battery dies very quickly. After a day or so of trying to figure out what was wrong with no solution, it started working normally again. Then a few days later it starts messing up doing the same thing again. This time I contacted the seller and they ran me through the normal things that I found on google that I already tried. And when all else failed they wanted me to send it back. I couldn't send it back right away because I don't have that option at work so they offered a partial refund. I assumed on a $270 purchase it would be at least 50% but they offered $25. And after I told them that it was an insult to receive such a low refund for a malfunctioning phone that I had for a week, they stopped responding altogether.

I had the Note 5 model for 7 years, and it recently ended up underwater for a couple of days. So, as a loyal Android guy, I did some quick research and decided on the Galaxy Note 9. What a great choice! I'm loving this phone. I think it represents Samsung's best effort. I know they're making the Note 20 model now, but from what I've seen, the Note 9 is even preferred my many above that latest model. I plan on having this phone for some time. Good job, Samsung. Good job, Amazon, on the Renewal program!

column1: So glad I got this phone
column2: I searched for months trying to find the right phone and I finally choose the Samsung Galaxy note 9, it was very reasonably priced but it had all the features plus some that I wanted. I am so pleased with this phone. I've been using it for 2 months now and I do not regret my decision of choosing it. Everything runs more smoothly than any phone I've ever used. The battery, when fully charged, lasts an incredibly long time. If I'm not using it much the battery will last 24+ hours. I love the coloring feature that it has with the s-pen, I love the Samsung kids app that it has.....I could really go on and on. I love everything about this phone and I am 100% satisfied.

I ended up looking for a phone on Amazon due some issues with some website purchase. First of all, I read the reviews and most of the negative comments where about the device not being unlocked, but I saw no issue with that, I could get around that. I made the purchase and hoped for the best.The phone came in a white box and inside this box was the phone, a cable, wall charger, a sticker for a return if needed and a card that stated that this device was backed by the Amazon Renewed Guarantee. The phone looked relatively new, you can see some usage light scratches on the screen, but once you turn on the phone is like there aren't there. For the price, the conditions in what it came where excellent and at this point I haven't had any issues with it. I'll update this review after a month but at this point I don't see I'll have any issues.

This phone looks brand new, love the lavender color, and this was easy to set up with my SIM card.The battery life is amazing.I didn't want to spend $800-plus on a new phone, so the price for this was a big draw.So far this phone is fabulous, and I like having the headphone jack and SIM card in it, unlike the new phones that don't have those options.

Phone was purchased with Synergy. There was no scratch on the screen and back, just a tiny chip at the bottom where the stylus is located. Phone works just like new! I am extremely happy with my purchase. Phone was unlock and carrier was att just like I wanted. The phone came in two weeks ago and everything worked smooth so far.

I haven't had it that long but so far so good. The phone itself looks brand new, no scratches or dents etc even though it's refurbished. I love the large screen. Makes it so much easier to see what you're texting as well as watching videos. The speaker is loud and clear. Actually everything about this phone is impressive.

The battery in this phone runs out extremely quickly! I bought as a gift for a family member and have been attempting to have a replacement sent to no avail. The phone battery dies very quickly and does not hold a charge. I’ve attempted to contact the company to have a replacement sent out but can only do so if I return the device first, which is redundant. I purchased the phone because it was needed and if I return it, then I have to wait for the return to be processed before a replacement will be sent out, which defeats the purpose of buying the cell phone in the first place. Definitely will not purchase anything from here in the future.

Was skeptical about a few reviews but ended up pulling the trigger anyways. Seriously a great phone, a huge step up from my old Motorola that died when the battery was at 40%. Facial recognition didn't really work that well for me, so I turned it off and opted to use the fingerprint scanner instead, which I prefer anyways. Overall, a great purchase and good seller.

column1: Quality and fast & capable customer support.
column2: I was very concerned about buying renewed for $400 items, especially a cell.But Hybrid IT was right on top of customer care.The main thing is the phone works well & not looking damaged.The accessories were secondary.However, this one came with the phone and charger (not oem).The charging cable was a slow one and I mentioned it to the seller. In less than a day, a customer rep called me to handle it. She said they would a refund me,( a very fair $) to get a cable here. I found a fast cable at a dollar store, plugged into their adapter, and all is well.I would buy from Hybrid IT again.I did not test all of the ph capabilities yet, but it covered all my concerns so far.It doesn't matter that it was a sprint unlocked. I put in my nano sim from T-mobile and it moved seamlessly.Same with the smart switch from my pre-owned Amazon Note 5, all moved over fine.If all renewed and refurbished worked this way, there is no reason not to buy.
Its an amazing phone. I have had no issues with it. It arrived just as described.

I have always bought my Samsung Notes new but when my Note 8's is camera broke it was time to look into an upgrade. The days of me paying a $1000 for a phone were long gone in my head so a new Note 10 or 20 were out of the question.The Note 9 however has always appealed to me as the last great Note series with even better battery life than the newer Notes.It was selling at a good price for a renewed version on Amazon so I took a leap of faith and bought one.I say a leap of faith because one I had never bought used and two I had heard horror stories and read horrible reviews about people who had such bad experiences buying renewed phone.I was a bit skeptical to say the least but I bought the Note 9 anyway and I can honestly say I could not be happier with its condition and how quickly it was delivered. I would not be able to tell that the phone had ever been used before because it came in perfect and pristine condition.I even received an actual Samsung charger with it which many people in their reviews complained the seller would send some cheap knock off charger instead.Maybe I'm one of the lucky ones and only time will tell if the battery lasts and everything keeps working as great as it is now but for now I am thrilled with my decision to buy the phone.

I ordered this phone as a replacement for my Note 8 after the screen went bad, and upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised that it looked brand new. It arrived 2 days ahead of the projected shipping date, but I was unable to activate it. Upon further investigation, I discovered that it was locked to Sprint. I contacted Sprint to attempt to unlock it, and they stated that they couldn't unlock it without specific information about the previous account that it was linked to, which I would have to obtain from the seller.I then contacted Amazon customer care, and they stated that as Prime Mobility is a third party seller, all they could do on my behalf was email the seller and submit a request for them to contact me. The seller contacted me in less than 24 hours and informed me that they were unable to unlock the phone for me or provide the information necessary for me to have Sprint unlock the phone, and that I would have to submit a return request, leaving me to have to shop around for another phone and wait additional days with no functioning phone or spend money out of pocket on a cheap phone from walmart while I wait for a new phone that meets my needs to arrive.I am very frustrated, and for the price, I expected the product that I ordered to be as advertised-fully unlocked to all carriers. I am now gun-shy to order another phone online and risk it not working with my carrier.

column1: Similar to new, with one small defect
column2: I purchased my product from Hybrid IT. Looking up my IMEI number, my device was originally purchased about a year and a half before I bought it (in March 2019). My model number is SM-N960U1, which means I got the US Snapdragon version that was originally factory unlocked (despite me purchasing an AT&T locked phone). The original owner apparently used Sprint on it, but after uninstalling the Sprint software it worked just like a normal factory unlocked processor.For anyone looking to purchase a Galaxy Note 9 two years after its launch, know you're getting a great phone hardware-wise but which will probably stop receiving software updates soon. I plan on using the Microsoft Launcher after OneUI Home started taking 10% of my battery life, and switching to LineageOS once security updates stop later this year.Pros + It came in rather good condition, albeit with a couple small scuff marks along the side and some dust in the speaker grill. + Almost all the features I've tried so far seem to work without issue (WiFi, Bluetooth, most S Pen funtionality, Dolby Atmos, DeX, wireless charging, heatbeat sensor, iris scanning) + My battery health was 93%, well in excess of Amazon's minimum of 80% That means my battery capacity is 3700 mAh instead of the original 4000 mAh, which is enough for my phone to last a good 6-7 hours with the screen on right now.Cons - It came in a nondescript box (no markings, definitely not original), with no particular packaging material aside from a bubble wrap sleeve. I also received no original documentation and none of the replacement S Pen tips/tip remover that normally comes with the Galaxy Note 9. The tip provided seems to have been one of the softer ones - softer than my preference, but OK. - The S Pen's EMR technology works properly, but it's wireless connectivity seems to be shot. Either the internal supercapacitor is dead and can't hold a charge, or the wireless communication circuitry is broken. It's also possible that this is a cheap clone S-pen without wireless capabilities. - It wasn't updated to the latest OneUI version before factory reset, which required an hour-long download before I could reliably use it---Minor pluses that aren't really device-specific - Using bxActions to remap the Bixby button to Google Assistant worked!Minor issues that might not be device-specific (none of my friends have a Note 9 for me to compare to) - None of the GCam ports I've tried work on this phone - The mechanical shutter is quite loud for some reason - The face unlock/iris scanning reliability is a little iffy - Fingerprint recognition takes a while to register when using LastPass

column1: This phone stole my heart. Goodbye Pixel 4!
column2: I'm obsessed with this phone. It's definitely big, and took a small adjustment period to get used to holding my phone with two hands lol. It's super light weight. Battery life is pretty solid, and it has so many battery saving options to extend it even further. The screen is super adjustable, from the lighting/dim/dark mode, all the way to this thing called "edge", which is the edges all around the screen. I'm obsessed with the edge color flash! I love that I can do 5x6 icons and fit more of my apps on one slide. I have straight talk and after a little bit of customer support, I got my phone fully working with a new sim. It comes with a fast charger, and it takes a C charger, which is awesome cause I had a pixel 4 before and it took Usb C as well! I'm so grateful to finally have a fingerprint reader back too! The space on it is a lifesaver. The stylus and drawing apps are awesome. They even have a tattoo ink style of writing that, again, I'm OBSESSED with. You can take pictures and stuff with the stylus as well. This is probably thee most customizable awesome phone I've ever held in my hand. And I've been all the way from iphone to Android to Google pixels. So far I definitely prefer this phone to the pixel 4. I had the pixel 3 before and loved it the most until this one. The camera on this thing is incredible! And this screen is absolutely perfect for when I wanna lay in bed and watch a show on my phone! 5/5!

column2: Phone arrived on time and in excellent condition. Works like new. Nice fast charger and cable included.

I have purchased this product about 5 times. They have all been good exept this last one I got. There's water damage or something in the charging port so without a wireless charger charging sucks. It also comes to an encrypted s reen only when my phones dies it doesn't like to done button for my pin. So, I have to sit there rehitting and holding done until it worked so I can get in my phone. Forst time ive been frustrated with there product
Lots of scratches in back side. This phone is NOT LIKE NEW
Excelente. Estoy muy contento con el dispositivo. Estética de 9.8 y funcionalidad de 10. Muy a gusto con la compra, llevo con el 20 días y todo muy bien. En lo personal lo recomiendo.Muchas gracias.

column1: So far a great transaction and product - Note9
column2: Any concerns I had about buying used were lifted by this transaction and the virtually new Note 9.. Have used it for over a week and tested everything. Transferred my sim from my old Note2 and worked immediately after rebooting.Having used Samsung Note phone for over 7 years, I was pleasantly surprised by its speed and overall generally better layout of everything.And the screen and brightness are a vast improvement over the old Note2. Battery life is also quite amazing.This unit comes in a plain box with a charger and usb to usb c cable.The seller was IBuzz and was fulfilled by Amazon.

column1: Calidad a buen precio, pero accesorios deficientes
column2: Ahora mismo lo estoy probando llevo 4 días con el y hasta el momento todo va perfecto, con la excepción de que llega en un empaque muy muy diferente al original, pero yo creo que eso es lo de menos ya que al tener un celular de esta calidad por ese precio vaya, no hay problema alguno, lo malo es que el cargador con el que lo recibí se calienta horrible y no carga el celular se tarda horas. Tuve que conseguir otro por que la calidad del cargador deja mucho que desear, seguiré utilizándolo esperando que todo siga perfecto.

Es la segunda vez que compro un producto Renewed y afortunadamente me han salido muy bien, en este caso era importante ya que no era para mí…Sólo hay dos detalles a considerar.1. El distribuidor DHL abrió el paquete, se nota como fue cortado e incluso mayugado para meterlo y sacarlo del empaque que Amazon envía. MUY MAL. Yo me espanté terriblemente porque bien podían cambiar el paquete por otra cosa y se haría irrasteable el mismo. Ni si quiera tuve que abrir la caja esta vez con un cutter o tijeras, sólo meter mi mano que cabía perfectamente…2. El celular venía descargado en su totalidad, lo que significa un peligro ya que al ser importado y puede ser un viaje largo, la batería al llegar al 0% definitivo puede morir y llegar al destinatario sin poder utilizarae.Afotunadamente ninguno de los inconvenientes pasó a una tragedia…Recomendaría que si Amazon contrata a otro distribuidor externo, como lo fue DHL; el destinatario les tomara sus datos e incluso una foto de cómo recibe y por quién recibe, por si hay algún inconveniente como a mí me pasó.Los puntos realmente buenos que tuve con el proveedor fueron que éste me dio cargador, cable y adaptador originales. También me dieron la plumita para sacar la sim o la memoria. Lo cual me sorprendió mucho ya que al comprar estos productos te dan accesorios genéricos.Sin duda alguna recomendados.

Note 9 M,Black 128GB @ toronto.cellularNo back/camera/screen/side scratches/scuffs, good battery performance, S-Pen just like new, Mic and speaker are perfect, typeC and audio plug are perfect, software is not updated(still One UI v1) & can only be updated manually but performance is perfect, finger print scanner have little scuffs but works in perfect condition. It does come with a "renewed amazon" box with a charger and a sim ejector tool.

column1: Es un seor telefonazo, altamente recomendado!
column2: Llegó rápido, llego totalmente desbloqueado tal como lo prometia la publicacion, corre rapidisimo, la pantalla excelente, le funciona todo genial, para cualquier operadora GSM, y traia la rom internacional lo mejor de todo, sin bloatware, de verdad se lucieron.

column1: Thumbs up to the Samsung Note 9 (Amazon renewed)
column2: Had some apprehension about purchasing a used cellphone.My concerns were put to rest after receiving and using this Note 9 for a while.As a long time Note user, I knew what to expect regarding performance and features. It was the condition of the unit and battery life I was worried about.Besides arriving in a plain box, the phone looks new and functions perfectly.There are no scratches, signs of wear, nothing...and the battery life is great.

column1: Stop researching phones and get the Note 9!
column2: 3 days in and I can already tell this is the best phone I have ever had. Phone arrived very fast and in mint condition. If someone used this phone they must have been very careful with it because I would have assumed this phone is new. It has small but important features like the LED notification light and the headphone jack that the Note 10 does not have. And of course wireless charging is built in and is a huge game changer. Even though its almost 2 years old this is the best phone you can buy in my opinion.

Got this phone to replace my Huawei p20 pro. Was used to front mounted fingerprint sensor but am finding the rear mounted one on this phone is more comfortable to use.The camera has a "single shot" feature that automatically pics out the best pics and small clip videos over a set time which I thought was pretty cool.Am loving the stylus function as I can edit things quickly on the go, or let my daughter play with the coloring book when she's bored.Phone is very responsive, with a very good battery life, and beautiful display.Absolutely a worthwhile phone and I highly recommend

When I first bought it the battery seemed not good enough, comparable to my 2-3 year old Note 8, which I was replacing. The seller was super super cooperative - offered help, guidance and to exchange it right away. After doing some tests I felt comfortable to swap it with another phone, which I did. The seller was truly unbelievable in their support. Responds almost immediately even on weekends and evenings. I'm completely happy with my replacement and the experience. Strongly recommend anyone todeal with this seller.

Product arrived very fast by Air courier. I was very leery about buying RENEWED but after opening the box and starting this phone up. I couldn't be more pleased. The phone is absolutely brand new, no scratches, no marks on it at all. Battery is 100%. It looks like I got a brand new phone not a RENEWED one. The charger and USB cable are original Samsung items not after market. Charging is quick and the device holds charge very well.

We ordered (2) Note 9's. Both came on time, both looked like new. both came with a New samsung quick charge adapter and usb C cable.1st phone worked awesome.2nd phone:- quick charge adapter was no good.- phone was giving me notifications to install a sprint sim card that came with the phone, only No sprint sim card came with the phone as I bought a "Samsung Galaxy Note 9, 128GB, Midnight Black - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)" and I did not want to have a sprint sim card.I contacted Toronto Cellular and they promptly sent out a new quick charge adapter, 1st problem SOLVED :)Then they walked me through steps (2 different ways) to clear sprint from my phone, neither way worked. So they sent me a shipping label to return my phone and then they fixed it and sent it back PERFECT :DTHANK YOUTORONTO CELLULAR

Sirve para compaia Flash Movil aca en Mexico. lo unico es que tuve que agregarle a la configuracion para que agarrara los datos moviles pero una googleada rapida y me aparecio como realizarlo rapido.La pantalla y la camara estan en muy buena calidad si acaso la pluma aveces se atora por si misma pero todo lo demas 10/10

column1: Like new condition, fast delivery, works in Canada, excellent customer service
column2: We have just received the phone in perfect condition. Ordered a new cheap Lucky mobile SIM for my mother in law who arrived in Canada to help with kids, It works well in Canada. She is happy. Thank you Toronto Cellular very much!In our situation ordering new expensive phones makes no sense as we have small children, and few new phones have broken displays. Fixing is expensive, so, the option to purchase refurbished from Toronto Cellular instead of repairing was an excellent idea. We have purchased 5 phones from Toronto Cellular within 3 months already and only one needed warranty replacement. Exchange was easy, fast and efficient due to excellent customer service. Hope there will be no need to change any one again. And we know where to order in case kids break the phone again.Thank you Toronto Cellular for your excellent service.

column1: This Note 9 is a good buy, and you never look back.
column2: I just received this Certified Refurbished Samsung Galaxy Note 9 as a delivery Saturday past. I am very impressed brand new (renewed) as expected no scratches, and unlocked, and using this phone very comfortable. It's like I learned all the new features in one day. I recommend the note 9.

The phone is in good condition, and does not seem to have been used very much previously (even has the original plastic wrapping on the Samsung charger/cable that came with the phone). The Note 9 is still an excellent device even by today's standards, especially if you need the MicroSD slot and audio jack. Look forward to testing it out over long term use.
Put all my worries to rest when I received the package today. Like new, everything works well. Plugged in a Freedom Mobile sim and everything works just fine. Happy with my purchase.

El dispositivo llegó en buen estado, sin rayones y todo funcionando correctamente, no tuve problemas con la red en este caso Telcel. La cámara es buena y el lápiz venía funcionando sin problemas. Llegó antes de lo esperado.
brand new never refurbished. very satisfied. main board serial is registered at samsung and serial matches the laser etched on the backglass. no scratches whatsoever
Upgraded from note 4 and it's so much better in every way, had it for 6 months and never even rebooted it once yet
It's unlocked and I received a Samsung charger with it. I don't know about the battery life yet. I'll update this review if I have any issues.

This product was delivered on-time and as promised. Looked brand new, works great and as advertised. I am not easy to get a positive review from but in this case I feel obligated as they came through with a perfect product. Was sceptical but happy I made the jump. Well done.
Great phone!!My wife is happy with it.Takes awesome pictures and I love the enhanced functionality as well as the security features.
Excellent quality, refurbished item in excellentcondition packaged like brand new, would recommend anytime.
Arrived on time, well packaged and looks very new as if never used.

El celular está hermoso, el color, el diseo, y el funcionamiento ni se diga. al principio tenía miedo que al no ser un celular nuevo viniera con fallas, pero tengo poco más de tres semanas con el y está perfecto.
This is a great refurbished phone in excellent condition. Much thinner than my previous phone.
Fantastic phone and even better seller. Even if you have any problems with your purchase you will be met with the best people helping you through your problem.
Just like new. Never had a problem and was unlocked when i got it.
Put my SIM card in and it worked right away. Charger it came with didn't work. Would get very hot. Otherwise great product.
Jussssst a little scratch at bottom corner on the metal frame . I used a protect case so it does not bother me at all. Great for such a used Note 9 .
Se tarda algunos días en llegar pero el producto esta excelente.Estética de 10. Cargador original.Funciona perfecto con Mdgamovil que es la compaía en la que estoy.

column1: Everything works as advertised. It's like a new phone.
column2: This is a "renewed" phone but it appears new with no scratches or dents. I've used it for two weeks now and everything works like new. Even the battery life is like a new phone!
Funciona muy bien y pasar los datos, apps de mi cel anterior fue muy fácil
Love this phone. So smooth and the stylist is a nice added feature I didnt think was useful before
El producto llegó muy rápido y exactamente como lo describen.Lo recomiendo mucho por la calidad precio.
Lo único malo es que no traía el cargador y caja original pero de ahí en fuera todo excelente.
Very beautiful phone works on my freedom Network in Canada perfectly fine I am very pleased with this phone
Looks and feels brand new. Very satisfied.
Phone looked almost new and everything worked as it should. Really happy with the purchase
Great phone, like new
My new phone arrived after only a few days, and looks and performs like new.Excellent!

column2: Too early to say about all the features, so far everything is as advertised.
It’s working fine

Llego en perfecto estado, estoy muy satisfecho

column1: Nice, but not the colour I've asked for..
column2: The phone is really nice and seems to work really good, but it arrived later thanexpected and blue instead of lavender.Update:The seller contacted me back and offered me a 40 pounds refund. :)

I am very disappointed with this product. The phone itself is amazing, and came in great condition, but stating that it is fully unlocked is an outright lie. The phone I received is a Verizon model,with the CSC locked to verizon. This means I cannot get software updates unless I have a Verizon sim card. Also, since this is the US snapdragon version, I cannot unlock the OEM to do any firmware updates myself.Nov-19 security is not ok with me, nor should it be ok with anyone else. This phone should not be sold in the Canadian marketplace if it cant be used properly in Canada. I feel as though this company is preying on customers who are not tech savvy enough to know that they got sold a brick.
Me encantó que a pesar de decir Verizon al inicio, mi tel viene desbloqueado y actualmente operando con telcel, no me encanta que le falten algunos accesorios pero ... puedo vivir con ello

Me encanto que llegara al día siguiente 5 dias antes de lo esperado, es lo mismo que describe amazon renewed, trae su pluma original y un cargador generico. El celular es muy bueno aun sea del 2018 no pude conseguir mejor celular! relacion precio-calidad

Me arriesgué a adquirir el equipo con los comentarios negativos y positivos.En mi caso se escucha muy bien las llamadas.Pero....Tiene ligera pantalla fantasma en la parte inferior.Y lo peor es que a pesar de no estar conectado a nada, indica que esta cargando un dispositivo externo.Estéticamente esta en condiciones excelentes.Actualización 27/08/2021.La batería se infló, se esta despegando la tapa trasera.

column1: Fayó  en función de llamadas telefónicas a las 3 semanas.
column2: Dejo de funcionar a las 3 semana. Se quedó sin recibir o sacar llamadas y cuando lo llevé con mi proveedor de línea telefonica me indicaron que era una faya del aparato.Procedí a la devolución porque no encontré la opción de un cambio del equipo.Lastima porque estaba muy bonito.

notlike at allproduct doesn'twork properlyi amprocessingforreturningandi am verydisappointedaboutthatthanks

Excelente producto , es verizon pero esta liberado para cualquier compaía,se puede usar en México sin problema , y además es la versión de procesador snapdragon,muy recomendado

column1: El producto llegó en excelentes condiciones y me ha funcionado perfectamente
column2: Me gustó mucho la forma de el envío y queel producto llegó en excelentes condiciones

column1: Muy buen servicio,  felicidades al proveedor
column2: Llegó sin ningún detalle, excelente estado, funciona súper bien

Overall the phone looked new but I was very disappointed to find that the external speaker wasn't working. The person on the other end of the call couldn't hear me. I wasn't expecting such things to happen after reading that the phone was thoroughly maintained to eliminate any defective part.

Arrived a day early. Overall good condition, there was only a single scratch on the back which isn't too noticeable. Battery seems to be new. It didn't come with the original box and the unofficial charger was in very bad condition and speed was only 0.7 amps (very slow) however that was expected since the listing said so. Came with the original S Pen which is also in like new condition, didn't notice a single scratch on that. Got it for my Canadian Public Mobile Sim and all the features work perfectly. (Some reviews said that they couldn't send images via text/MMS, but I never had that issue.) The phone I got was truly unlocked and didn't have any carrier-related bloatware. Also for those wondering it does not come with a screen protector. Overall satisfied!Edit: forgot to update this review in a while. Started noticing problems with the original phone on the second day, the signal was very poor no matter where I was and it had a hard time receiving/sending messages and calls, seems like the antenna was defective. Sent back and ordered the same one again, this time it was a good working one. Also it arrived with the stock Samsung charger, cable, sim tool, screen protector and a 1 month koodo trial sim. Only things I've noticed is that the fingerprint ready came very scratched but it still works very quickly. Currently using the phone for several months and still no issues.

column1: Deberian ser las precisos al decir que el telefono tendra mucho detalles
column2: Llego en tiempo estimado. Pero el telefono se ve muydeteriorado. Conmigo fue mentira que luce como nuevo. La Spen no funciona, trae muchos raspones. Realmente no lo recomiendo.

column1: Not Canadian firmware. Manual service provider firmware update required.
column2: It was shipped with android 9 under a Sprint mobile (USA) firmware. Updated the firmware manually to Bell Canada. Phone looks new. Miniscule scratches on fingerprint reader.4 stars because I had to manually do the firmware upgrade. Not difficult by any means. Works perfectly fine now.

column1: Creo que fue solo mala suerte. Que me salió malo
column2: Se veía muy bien. Casi nuevo solo que fallaba el lápiz al usarlo de trababa.

phone in great condition no marks or scratches and no defects, so far battery life looks good, minor complaint it came with a cheap Chinese power block and cable, and no tools to remove the SIM card tray,had to use a paper clip. So far very satisfied.

So I bought two of these phones, both of them had charging issues. I returned the first one and bought a second. I think the issues with both phones were the chargers they supplied. I took the second phone, I purchased, to a cellphone repair place and they plugged it in and it seems fine now. Bought one of their changers and no issues so far. If you plan on buying this phone, buy a high end charger. Cheap chargers and cables dont seem to be compatible. I however really like the phone itself.

column1: Great deal for a powerful phone
column2: The phone arrived on time with no defects and looked brand new. It worked with my bell sim card however I think it is a US model unlocked since the Samsung pay was the US version. Other than that the phone was perfect and has all the same specs as the ad said. Very satisfied with my purchase overall
seems fast and battery life good so far - i've only had it up and running for 24 hours but no issues with my sim card - all my info transfered.very happy so far

column1: Great people to deal with, phone exactly as described.
column2: Phone arrived in great condition, packaging could have been better in the box but the phone was protected with Bubble Wrap so it was okay.I will deal with them again!

column1: Signal drops and loss of connectivity
column2: Overall a very good product,but I am not sure is it my device or the model , it seems to be dropping signals on time to time. It shows late with full / semi full strength but unfortunately it losses data connection in multiple places.Also the s-pen has minor design issue, the top button rattles while using the phone quickly.
Apart from charger, which is not fast as expected, I am satisfied with my purchase. Thank you Toronto cellular.

So this is my second time buying a Note9 from this "certified refurbished" company on Amazon.The first phone was in great shape, and worked well (for three weeks). One day it just shut down, and never turned on again. I took it to a Samsung authorized repair center, and they said there was water damage (not recent) and that the motherboard was covered in rust.I've never had this phone come close to getting wet by any means, so obviously it was water damaged prior to me taking delivery.I ended up sending that one back, and getting another one. The second one looks like it was beat on pretty bad by the last owner. It works, and does what it should, and we will see how things go with this phone.Just be careful with this company, because it seems their "refurbishing" process is a little sketchy.
Great phone n definitely worth it. My pen was broken so I got a new 1 sent for free s

column1: Mo me llegó la pluma, llegó incompleto el equipo, ya había mandado mensaje y no me responden
column2: Todo bien :) pero el equipo me llegó sin la pluma

Bought the "Canadian Version" of the refurbished Note 9, but I'm not sure it's actually the Canadian version and there are a few issues. Most annoyingly it's got "OMADM" installed (system app that can't be removed) and as far as I can see that would be for Sprint (American carrier). Every time you restart the device it's going to unsuccessfully try to register the device through OMADM and you'll be left with a notification you can't delete unless you go through a fairly involved process to force stop the application (which you will need to repeat every single time you restart the device). Secondly, about 60% of incoming calls don't connect (the caller hears a few beeps, call drops, does not forward to VM). I don't get a ton of calls so not a huge deal but certainly disappointed.
This is awesome, I have no regrets

El paquete llegó en tiempo. Y al ser reacondicionado estaba consciente de los detalles estéticos, sin embargo eso era mínimo.El verdadero problema es que la bocina del altavoz ya sonaba muy mal. Se escuchaba como una bocina ya reventada y me daba la impresión de que dentro de poco dejaría de funcionar por completo, así que no valía la pena conservarlo.
No incluía accesorios, el cristal tenía pequeas ralladuras

column1: Not entirely impressed with the refurbishing
column2: One third of the display seems to be a slightly different shade than the rest of the screen, almost as if some of the backlight isn't lighting up properly. Otherwise the phone looks mint and functions exactly as expected and works with my carrier dispite it being the snapdragon model. However it's a shame that the most important part of the phone is the part I noticed an issue with.

column1: There may be problems with phone or spen!!!
column2: Spen is always disconnected. Check the Settings to show that spen is on.Every use, always pull out the pen first, and then, after plugging into the phone, connect to the phone, repeatedly want 2 minutes.More vexed.

Phone arrived quickly & looked to be in good condition. Got it all set up before I realized there's a line in the screen (screen burn or replaced glass done poorly). Screen is also not super responsive. Super disappointing and will be sending it back.
Está en muy mal estado,
